sentences.sContent: A stolen car smashed into the bus.
sentences.sCn: 一辆被偷的汽车猛地撞上了公共汽车。

sentences.sContent: He smashed his fist down on the table.
sentences.sCn: 他把拳头狠狠地砸在桌上。

synos.tran: 了不起的；非常轰动的；出色的

phrases.pCn: n. 非常流行的东西；轰动的演出

words.tran: 了不起的，极好的；粉碎性的，猛烈的
击碎者；撞击物；扣球手；猛烈的打击
粉碎（smash的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to hit an object or surface violently, or to make something do this

trans.tranCn: 使粉碎，使打烂；狠打，猛击；使破灭，使失败
trans.tranOther: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

trans.tranCn: 破碎； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
trans.tranOther: the loud sound of something breaking
